rules.name: bomb-squigs
rules.exampleReason: Reminder-only rule with manual activation and once-per-battle limit. Shows that rules can have empty conditions/effects arrays when they just need to remind the player.

rule.name: Bomb Squigs
rule.description: Once per battle, for each bomb squig this unit has, after this unit ends a Normal move, you can use one Bomb Squig. If you do, select one enemy unit within 12" and visible to this unit and roll one D6: on a 3+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. **Designer's Note:** Place two Bomb Squig tokens next to the unit, removing one each time this unit uses this ability.

rules.name: wild-ride-movement
rules.exampleReason: Reminder-only rule showing that many abilities that can't be calculated in combat should still be implemented as reminders. Even if we can't compute the effect, we can remind the player at the right time. NOTE: This rule activates in TWO phases (movement and charge), so we create TWO rule objects with the same name but different phase values.

rule.name: Wild Ride
rule.description: You can ignore any or all modifiers to this unit's Move characteristic and to Advance and Charge rolls made for this unit.

rules.name: wild-ride-charge
rules.exampleReason: Second part of Wild Ride rule. Shows that a single written rule often needs to be split into multiple rule objects when it activates in different phases. Both rules share the same name and description but have different activation phases.

rule.name: Wild Ride
rule.description: You can ignore any or all modifiers to this unit's Move characteristic and to Advance and Charge rolls made for this unit.

rules.name: waaagh-charge-after-advance
rules.exampleReason: Part 4 of Waaagh!. Shows a reminder-only rule that grants an ability we can't calculate. Together, these 4 Waaagh! rules show how to decompose complex faction abilities into independent, testable pieces.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army and: Units from your army with this ability are eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which they Advanced. Add 1 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models from your army with this ability. Models from your army with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

rules.name: might-is-right
rules.exampleReason: Demonstrates is-leading condition for CHARACTER units that lead bodyguard units. Shows scope: 'unit' rule that applies to the led unit when the leader is attacking.

rule.name: Might is Right
rule.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

rules.name: tank-hunter
rules.exampleReason: Demonstrates target-category conditions (VEHICLE) and reroll effects. Shows how to handle "against X targets" mechanics.

rule.name: Tank Hunter
rule.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a VEHICLE unit, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

rules.name: dakka-dakka-dakka
rules.exampleReason: Simple automatic keyword addition. Shows the most basic pattern: check weapon type condition, add keyword. No user input needed.

rule.name: Dakka Dakka Dakka
rule.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, an unmodified hit roll of 6 automatically wounds the target.

rules.name: furious-charge
rules.exampleReason: Shows unit-status conditions (charged) and temporary duration (turn). Demonstrates abilities that trigger based on unit actions.

rule.name: Furious Charge
rule.description: Each time this unit makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in this unit.

rule.name: Da Biggest and da Best
rule.description: +4 Attacks

rule.name: Inspiring Presence
rule.description: +1 to wound

rule.name: Mob Rule
rule.description: +1 to wound

rule.name: Mob Mentality
rule.description: +1 to hit

rule.name: Inspiring Aura
rule.description: +1 to wound

rule.name: Boy Specific Ability
rule.description: Empty reminder

rule.name: Boy Model Only
rule.description: Empty reminder

rules.name: waaagh-call
rules.exampleReason: Part 1 of Waaagh! ability. Shows manual activation with once-per-battle limit. Demonstrates activating army-wide state. This reminder tells the player to activate the Waaagh! state, which the other 3 Waaagh! rules depend on.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army.

rules.name: waaagh-strength
rules.exampleReason: Part 2 of Waaagh!. Shows army-state conditions (waaagh-active) and weapon stat modification. Demonstrates how global faction abilities affect combat.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army and: Add 1 to the Strength characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models from your army with this ability.

rules.name: waaagh-attacks
rules.exampleReason: Part 3 of Waaagh!. Same pattern as waaagh-strength but for Attacks characteristic. Shows how decomposing complex rules makes them easier to test and maintain.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army and: Add 1 to the Attacks characteristics of melee weapons equipped by models from your army with this ability.

rules.name: waaagh-toughness
rules.exampleReason: Part 4 of Waaagh! (defensive). Shows modDefensiveStat effect for Toughness. Demonstrates defensive stat modification during Waaagh! when unit is being attacked.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army and: Add 1 to the Toughness of models from your army with this ability.

rules.name: waaagh-invuln
rules.exampleReason: Part 5 of Waaagh! (defensive). Shows setInvuln effect and defensive timing. Demonstrates that Waaagh! has both offensive and defensive benefits.

rule.name: Waaagh!
rule.description: If your Army Faction is Orks, once per battle, at the start of your Command phase, you can call a Waaagh! If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, the Waaagh! is active for your army and: Models from your army with this ability have a 5+ invulnerable save.

rules.name: krumpin-time
rules.exampleReason: Another stat modification rule. Shows basic pattern with no special conditions beyond combat role and weapon type.

rule.name: Krumpin' Time
rule.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of that attack.

rules.name: skulking-horrors
rules.exampleReason: Reactive rule that modifies wound rolls. Shows defensive reactive trigger type.

rule.name: Skulking Horrors
rule.description: Each time an attack targets this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

rules.name: drive-by-dakka
rules.exampleReason: Toggle-based user input. Shows how to handle player-declared state (Advanced this turn?). Demonstrates turn-based state tracking.

rule.name: Drive-by Dakka
rule.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack, if it Advanced this turn, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

rule.name: Damage Boost (Leader)
rule.description: Leader-only test rule that adds +2 damage

rules.name: shooty-power-trip
rules.exampleReason: Radio input representing die roll outcomes with multiple effects. Shows that not all options need effects (1-2 causes mortal wounds, handled outside combat calculator). Demonstrates random ability outcomes (ask the player).

rule.name: Shooty Power Trip
rule.description: Each time this unit is selected to shoot, you can roll one D6: On a 1-2, this unit suffers D3 mortal wounds. On a 3-4, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit. On a 5-6, until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in this unit.

rules.name: waaagh-energy
rules.exampleReason: Demonstrates radio input with multiple options based on unit size. Shows how effects scale with context (more models = stronger ability, but we can just ask the player for complicated conditional state). Example of leader-only effects using scope.

rule.name: Waaagh! Energy
rule.description: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to the Strength and Damage characteristics of this model's 'Eadbanger weapon for every 5 models in that unit (rounding down), but while that unit contains 10 or more models, that weapon has the [HAZARDOUS] ability.

rules.name: super-runts
rules.exampleReason: Demonstrates multiple effects with different conditions. Shows how to use if blocks to handle effect-level conditions (offensive +1 hit/wound, defensive -1 wound). Also shows parameterized unit ability (Scouts 9").

rule.name: Super Runts
rule.description: While this model is leading a unit: Models in that unit have the Scouts 9" ability. Each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll. Each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
